reference.title: DITA 1.3 proposed feature 13114
reference.shortdesc: Proposal to add the @rev attribute to the <title>.

section.title: Date and version information
section.p:
Include the following information:
First draft of proposal completed on 121312.
Initial proposal approved on 081412.

section.title: Use cases
section.p: The @rev attribute should be added to <title> so that changes to a title can be flagged for reviewers and regulatory agencies, especially in the medical device industry.

section.title: Proposed solution
section.p: Add the @rev attribute to the <title> for all topic types.

ul.li: This addition will benefit authors who require that a title be flagged for reviewers and regulatory agencies, especially in the medical device industry.

section.title: Technical requirements
section.p:
Provide a detailed description of how the solution will work. Be sure to include the following details:
DTD and Schema modifications
Topic or map specialization None
Domain None
Element Add the @rev attribute to the attribute list for <title>:<!ENTITY % title.attributes "%id-atts; %localization-atts; base CDATA #IMPLIED %base-attribute-extensions; rev CDATA #IMPLIED outputclass CDATA #IMPLIED" >
Attributes None
Processing impact Processors that explicitly ignore title elements for @rev processing would need to now account for the possibility of @rev on <title>.
Overall usability
This proposal would improve the usability of the topic title in situations where the title has been changed and requires review.
Pro The use of @rev attribute in <title> will simplify authoring by providing a useful function to the authors and to organizations with stringent review requirements.
Con None

section.title: Costs
section.p:
The impact would be as follows
A small costs to processors that support use of @rev for revision flagging (e.g., change bar generation), depending on the details of how those processors handle titles in different contexts.
DITA community-at-large would perceive this change as a minor improvement in convenience.

section.title: Examples
section.codeblock: <topic id="topicid"> <title rev="121212">Monitoring the patient following <draft-comment>deleted the word "during" and added the word "following"</draft-comment> the procedure.</title> ... <fig id="fig-01"> <title rev="121212">Patient monitoring produre flow following procedures. <draft-comment>deleted the word "during" and added the word "following"</draft-comment></title> ... </fig> ... </topic>
